result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brenda Johnson was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Brenda Johnson was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $350.00 plus all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges. To be paid by 2/8/2018 or a civil judgment will be entered.

Defendant's operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device and each  motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 18 months thereafter.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended  programming.  Driver Safety Plan form signed/filed.

To report by 2/17/2017 by 5:00 p.m.
Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work, treatment, dependency care and community service ordered on count four.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brenda Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Count one.  Per DCC, count one/monies ordered is NOT DOC collect.  Entered as so.

Defendant Brenda Johnson in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, treatment, dependency care, and community service hours ordered on Count 4. Defendant to report by 2/17/2017 by 5:00 pm.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 18 months.

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 18 months thereafter. 

AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.

Court ordered a fine of $350.00 PLUS all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid by 2/8/2018 or a civil judgment will be entered.

AS TO COUNT 4
Court sentenced defendant to 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction. Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, treatment, dependency care, and community service hours. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-30 hours of community service
-Progress toward GED
-Letter of apology to J.J. and the Police Officer.
-Vocational Rehabilitation Evaluation
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fee, and surcharges by 2/8/2018 or a civil judgment will be entered.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Sentencing Referral Form, Driver Safety Plan Form, and Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Brenda Johnson in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  

As to counts 1 and 4:

Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 31.

As to Count 2:  
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED.

As to Count 3:  
Pursuant to negotiations, Count 3 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

All bail conditions remains in placed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brenda Johnson in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  Due to court congestion,  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Pretrial Report, received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Brenda Johnson in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for status conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report, received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Brenda Johnson in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR
Held off the record. Defense has received discovery and and offer from the State. Defense requests time to review material with her client. Defense requests case be calendared for status. State does not object. Case calendared for status on 08/25/2016 at 08:30 am, Branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 08:30 am. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report Dated 08/08/2016, received and filed. LNR

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brenda Johnson in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Defendant Brenda Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan - Branch 31 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Brenda Johnson not in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-075

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/17/15 @ 1:30 pm
